comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Quality-Check-2

Commit message style: unix

Please check that the syntax of your ticket declaration(s) follows commit guidelines:
https://confluence.sierrawireless.com/display/LEGATO/Write+Commit+Messages

 - Your commit message should mention a module such as 'legato:'
 - Tickets are declared in the first line, you should use 'Resolves:' .
Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.

commits.commitMessage:
kernel: Modem not powerdown after send AT!POWERDOWN

Issue Description:
To verify module could boot up everytime within 1000 loops(AT!POWERDOWN),
at loop 246,Modem not powerdown after send AT!POWERDOWN

Root Cause:
mostly cause is code stuck in fuction kernel_power_off of reboot.c,
waiting for lock,watchdog timeout and go to reboot process.

Solution:
in this stuck code,lack of useful log information,and our solution is a workaround,
that iswhen powerdown cause code stuck and watchdog timeout,in wdog_bark_handler
forced device shutdown.

Change-Id: I1175de07e4a7d5d5a85b524fb86d28185238213f
Resolves: QTI9X40-4682
Signed-off-by: Peter Chen <pechen@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: kernel: Modem not powerdown after send AT!POWERDOWN

commits.commitMessage:
thermal: Avoid deadlock when awaiting completion

When kthread_stop() is called, the thread is woken, but it is stuck
waiting for completion forever.  Instead, limit the time waiting for
completion so that kthread_should_stop() can be checked.

Resolves: LXSWIREF-333
Change-Id: Ieb0c1d2b6cf656a889c7ab5e4060f661124ae50d
Signed-off-by: David Frey <dfrey@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: thermal: Avoid deadlock when awaiting completion
